Pick Initiator WWNs from available ones on array
Hosts folder to bind workflow in inventory

Set the PowerMax host flags.

Options:
    1. None: Override is set to none and Enabled is set to none.
    2. Override and Disabled: Override is set to true and Enabled is set to false.
    3. Override and Enabled: Override is set to true and Enabled is set to true.

If reuse existing host is yes and a host entry matching the name and requested parameters exist in the PowerMax array then the host entry will be returned and no new host creation will occur. The workflow will fail if the attributes of the existing host entry do not match the requested parameters.

By default reuse existing host is no and an attempt will be made to create a new host. New host creation will fail if another host entry exists with the same name as the new host.
Reuse existing host entry if one exists?

Options:
1. None: Override is set to none and Enabled is set to none.
2. Override and Disabled: Override is set to true and Enabled is set to false.
3. Override and Enabled: Override is set to true and Enabled is set to true.

If reuse existing host group is yes and a host group entry matching the name and requested parameters exist in the PowerMax array then the host group entry will be returned and no new host group creation will occur. The workflow will fail if the attributes of the existing host group entry do not match the requested parameters.

By default reuse existing host group is no and an attempt will be made to create a new host group. New host group creation will fail if another host group entry exists with the same name as the new host group.

workflows.name: Remove Host Group Access to Volumes

content.label: Storage group masked to the host group
Remove access to all volumes in the selected storage group?

If true, removing access to all volumes from an unmasked storage group will return success. Removing access to volumes from a storage group will be allowed even if some or all volumes are not part of the storage group.
Select a disk/LUN to create datastore. Only disks that are not in use by an existing VMFS are listed.

Select the VMFS 5 option to enable additional capabilities, such as 2TB+ support. VMFS-5 is not supported by hosts with an ESXi version earlier than 5.0.
Select the VMFS 3 option if the datastore will be accessed by legacy hosts.

The initial value of the Capacity field indicates the maxumin available space on the specified disk. Enter a lower number if you need less space or leave the initial value for using the maximum available space.

content.label:
Place host in maintenance mode automatically if needed.
If set to NO then make sure that the ESXi host is in maintenance mode prior to running the workflow.
Force execution regardless of potential data unavailability
Name for the linked target storage group
Existing storage group to be used as a link target
List of existing volumes on the array
Number of pairs to be created
Invalidate R1 flag: Invalidate the R1 volume as part of the pair creation
Invalidate R2 flag: Invalidate the R2 volume as part of the pair creation
Establish flag: Perform an SRDF esablish after the pairs are created
Format flag: No data synchronization is done between source and target dynamic SRDF pairs after all tracks are CLEARED on what will become the R1 and R2 side

Exempt flag: Allows volumes to be added, removed, or suspended without affecting the state of the SRDF/A or SRDF/Metro session or requiring that other volumes in the session be suspended. Used for an SRDF group supporting an active SRDF/A session or an active SRDF/Metro session
Metro bias flag: When RDF mode is set to Active, this flag specifies to use bias when creating an SRDF Metro pair. If set to false, Witness will be used.
The RDF group on source array
Name for the target storage group
Force new RDF group? Overrides the RDF Group selection functionality and forces the creation of a new RDF Group
Establish flag: Specifies if the pairs are to be established on creation
Metro bias flag: When RDF mode is set to Active, this flag specifies to use Bias when creating an SRDF Metro Pair. If set to false, Witness will be used.

Bypass flag: Bypasses any existing PowerMax exclusive locks during an SRDF operation. WARNING: Only use this flag if you are certain no other SRDF operation is in progress at the local and/or remote PowerMax arrays.
Metro bias flag: When the SRDF Mode is set to Active, this specifies to make the R1 Powermax the Bias
Full flag: Make the action a full establish as opposed to an incremental establish

Bypass flag: Bypasses any existing PowerMax exclusive locks during an SRDF operation. WARNING: Only use this flag if you are certain no other SRDF operation is in progress at the local and/or remote PowerMax arrays.

Remote flag: Requests a remote data copy flag. When the concurrent link is ready, data is copied to the concurrent SRDF mirror. These operations require the remote data copy option, or the concurrent link to be suspended.

Bypass flag: Bypasses any existing PowerMax exclusive locks during an SRDF operation. WARNING: Only use this flag if you are certain no other SRDF operation is in progress at the local and/or remote PowerMax arrays.
Restore flag: Begins a full copy from the target to the source, synchronizing the dynamic SRDF pairs. The dynamic SRDF device pairs swap personality and an incremental restore is initiated.
Immediate flag: Applies only to SRDF/Asynchronous-capable devices. Causes command to drop the SRDF/A session immediately.

Remote flag: Requests a remote data copy flag. When the concurrent link is ready, data is copied to the concurrent SRDF mirror. These operations require the remote data copy option, or the concurrent link to be suspended.
Establish flag: Begins a device copy. The dynamic SRDF device pairs swap personality and an incremental establish is initiated.
The RDF group on the array
The target RDF group that the pairs will be moved to
Half move flag: Moves one side of the dynamic SRDF pair from one SRDF group to another SRDF group.

Bypass flag: Bypasses any existing PowerMax exclusive locks during an SRDF operation. WARNING: Only use this flag if you are certain no other SRDF operation is in progress at the local and/or remote PowerMax arrays

Exempt flag:  Allows volumes to be added, removed, or suspended without affecting the state of the SRDF/A or SRDF/Metro session or requiring that other volumes in the session be suspended. Used for an SRDF group supporting an active SRDF/A session or an active SRDF/Metro session

Keep R1 flag: Sets the winner side of the SRDF/Metro group to the R1 or the R2 side, as specified. This option can be used when moving volumes out of the SRDF/Metro group but not when moving volumes into the group.

Keep R2 flag: Sets the winner side of the SRDF/Metro group to the R1 or the R2 side, as specified. This option can be used when moving volumes out of the SRDF/Metro group but not when moving volumes into the group.
The storage group RDF group whose pairs are to be deleted

Bypass flag: Bypasses any existing PowerMax exclusive locks during an SRDF operation. WARNING: Only use this flag if you are certain no other SRDF operation is in progress at the local and/or remote PowerMax arrays.
Metro bias flag: When the SRDF Mode is set to Active, this specifies to use Bias

Remote flag: Requests a remote data copy flag. When the concurrent link is ready, data is copied to the concurrent SRDF mirror. These operations require the remote data copy option, or the concurrent link to be suspended.
Full flag: Make the action a full restore as opposed to an incremental restore

Bypass flag: Bypasses any existing PowerMax exclusive locks during an SRDF operation. WARNING: Only use this flag if you are certain no other SRDF operation is in progress at the local and/or remote PowerMax arrays.

Remote flag: Requests a remote data copy flag. When the concurrent link is ready, data is copied to the concurrent SRDF mirror. These operations require the remote data copy option, or the concurrent link to be suspended.

Bypass flag: Bypasses any existing PowerMax exclusive locks during an SRDF operation. WARNING: Only use this flag if you are certain no other SRDF operation is in progress at the local and/or remote PowerMax arrays.
Mode: Sets the SRDF mode for one or more SRDF pairs to synchronous, asynchronous, adaptive copy disk mode or adaptive copy write pending mode.

Bypass flag: Bypasses any existing PowerMax exclusive locks during an SRDF operation. WARNING: Only use this flag if you are certain no other SRDF operation is in progress at the local and/or remote PowerMax arrays.
Consistent flag: Transitions from async to sync mode. Note: The consistent option is only allowed with the sync value.
Set skew? Note: The skew cannot be used with the async value.

Skew factor:  Sets the skew factor for the adaptive copy mode. Possible values range from 0 to 65,534 tracks. For devices larger than 2 GB, a value of 65,535 can be specified to target all the tracks of any given drive.

Bypass flag: Bypasses any existing PowerMax exclusive locks during an SRDF operation. WARNING: Only use this flag if you are certain no other SRDF operation is in progress at the local and/or remote PowerMax arrays.
Immediate flag: Applies only to SRDF/Asynchronous-capable devices. Causes command to drop the SRDF/A session immediately.

Bypass flag: Bypasses any existing PowerMax exclusive locks during an SRDF operation. WARNING: Only use this flag if you are certain no other SRDF operation is in progress at the local and/or remote PowerMax arrays.
Metro bias flag:  When the SRDF is set to Active, this specifies to move the Bias to the R2 PowerMax
Immediate flag: Applies only to SRDF/Asynchronous-capable devices. Causes command to drop the SRDF/A session immediately.

Consistency exempt flag:  	Allows devices to be suspended without affecting the state of the SRDF/A session or requiring that other devices in the session be suspended. Used for an SRDF group supporting an active SRDF/A session.

Bypass flag: Bypasses any existing PowerMax exclusive locks during an SRDF operation. WARNING: Only use this flag if you are certain no other SRDF operation is in progress at the local and/or remote PowerMax arrays.
Halfswap flag: Swaps the SRDF personality of one-half of the designated dynamic SRDF pair. Source R1 devices become target R2 devices, and target R2 devices become source R1 devices.
Refresh R1: Marks the source (R1) devices to refresh from the remote mirror.
Refresh R2: Marks the target (R2) devices to refresh from the remote mirror.
Name (Unique identifier with maximum length 64. Case will be ignored when checking uniqueness.)
If true, return existing storage group which is empty and matches all parameters provided
New name (Unique identifier with maximum length 40. Case will be ignored when checking uniqueness.)
